newsitem.title: USA: VDOnet adds former Time executive to board.
newsitem.headline: VDOnet adds former Time executive to board.

text.p: VDOnet Corp said on Thursday it has named the former editor of new media at Time Warner Inc's Time Inc to VDOnet's board of directors.

Paul Sagan, 37, was president and editor of the new media division at Time until last month and held senior management responsibility for the development of Time Inc's on-line, cable on-line, electronic publishing and Internet publishing activities.

"Video is an important bridge from where the Internet is today -- in many ways a novelty -- to a future where it will be the next true medium of business, entertainment and information," Sagan said in a statement.

Palo Alto-based VDOnet develops products for video broadcasting and telephony over computer networks, including the Internet global network. Investors in the privately-held company include Microsoft Corp, US West's USWest Media Group, NYNEX and Battery Ventures.
